etymology.description: 癶(癶) (bó, 'two outstretched feet') serves as the phonetic component + 殳(殳) (shū, 'hand with stick') as the semantic component = to beat or cut grass
etymology.interpretation: The character 癹(bá) combines the imagery of two feet, symbolizing motion, with a hand holding a stick, indicating cutting or clearing action. This suggests the action of beating or cutting grass, and it may have been an original form for words related to clearing or moving aside.
